content:
• Friday, June 28, 2013
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) -17.2% AH after an ITC administrative law judge rules Nokia, Huawei,...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) -17.2% AH after an ITC administrative law judge rules Nokia, Huawei, and ZTE didn't infringe 3G patents being asserted by the company; the commission will make a final ruling in October. InterDigital has filed multiple cases with the ITC related to its 3G and 4G patents; an ITC ruling ending an infringement investigation against LG was overturned earlier this month. A case was originally filed against Nokia, Huawei, and ZTE in July '11. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) jumps in the post session on reports that Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN)...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) jumps in the post session on reports that Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) is set to buy the company. Senior executives met a couple weeks back, which apparently was followed up by a letter in which AMGN noted that a combination of the two companies would be "very complementary." ONXX +21% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • VTSS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VTSS +3%. AMOV +2%. SNFCA +1%. ARNA +1%. IXJ +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VTSS +3%. AMOV +2%. SNFCA +1%. ARNA +1%. IXJ +1%.
    After-hours top losers: IDCC -8%. GLD -3%. TRMR -3%. JKHY -2%. BVN -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEC

    Unwired Planet (UPIP) announces a $50M financing deal to support its...

    Unwired Planet (UPIP) announces a $50M financing deal to support its patent-acquisition/licensing efforts. The company is selling $25M worth of senior notes, $12.5M worth of common stock, and $12.5M worth of equity rights to existing shareholders. At current levels, the equity sales would increase UPIP's share count by ~14%. The company had $48.5M in cash/investments on its balance sheet as of March 30, and no debt. (Ericsson deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: AMJ +5.3%. EWY +3.7%. TAN +3.3%. VNQ +3.1%. ILF +3.1%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: AMJ +5.3%. EWY +3.7%. TAN +3.3%. VNQ +3.1%. ILF +3.1%.
    ETF Losers: UNG -6.2%. GAZ -5.4%. SGOL -4.7%. GLD -4.7%. IAU -4.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • KGC

    Gold (GLD, IAU) and silver (SLV, PSLV) stocks finish with huge gains, as bargain hunters swoop...

    Gold (GLD, IAU) and silver (SLV, PSLV) stocks finish with huge gains, as bargain hunters swoop in to buy beaten-down miner shares. KGC +9.9%. ABX +5.9%. GG +8.5%. NG +9.3%. CDE +9.6%. SLW +7.5%. PAAS +7.1%. NEM +8.1%. SA +12.9%. SBGL +6.9%.  (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 18 Comments
  • HDY

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +3.5%) says its board has approved a 1-for-8 reverse stock split of its...

    Hyperdynamics (HDY +3.5%) says its board has approved a 1-for-8 reverse stock split of its common stock that will take effect with the beginning of trading on July 1, 2013. The split reduces the number of outstanding shares from approximately 168.4M to approximately 21.1M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -1.2%) shrugs off the positive news earlier of Soliris getting...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -1.2%) shrugs off the positive news earlier of Soliris getting Orphan Drug status to trade lower, after Zack's cut the shares to Neutral from Outperform with a price target of $98. The firm says all the positive news on Soliris is already baked-in to the shares at present.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • NKE

    It's a pretty good day to be long shoe stocks after reports from Nike (NKE +2.4%) and Finish...

    It's a pretty good day to be long shoe stocks after reports from Nike (NKE +2.4%) and Finish Line (FINL +4.2%) set the tone early and analysts jump on the bandwagon with positive comments on the sector: Advancers: Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) +2.9%, Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) +3.0%, Wolverine Worldwide (NYSE:WWW) +2.2%, Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX) +2.2%, Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCHL) +1.3%, Brown Shoe (BWS) +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACN

    In addition to IBM, several other enterprise IT names are pressured by Accenture's (ACN -10.3%)...

    In addition to IBM, several other enterprise IT names are pressured by Accenture's (ACN -10.3%) May quarter revenue miss (caused by consulting weakness), light guidance, and commentary about soft European demand. SAP (SAP -3.6%), Autodesk (ADSK -2.3%), Qlik (QLIK -2.1%), and Informatica (INFA -1.8%), all of whom have strong European exposure, are among the casualties. Other decliners include VMware (VMW -1.5%), Salesforce (CRM -1.9%), Teradata (TDC -1.8%), and CommVault (CVLT -3.9%). In his downgrade note on Accenture, Raymond James' Brian Gesuale mentioned "ERP [software consulting] work is showing signs of commoditization and short-term projects remain on the shelf." That might not be going over well with SAP investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • DNDN

    Wedbush analyst David Nierengarten says Dendreon's (DNDN +4.2%) chances with Provenge in the EU...

    Wedbush analyst David Nierengarten says Dendreon's (DNDN +4.2%) chances with Provenge in the EU are practically zero. While the EMA is likely to grant approval, Nierengarten asks "Who's going to make it?" He points out that no European manufacturer has yet stepped up to work with the company. "All-in," he concludes, "we do not estimate any sales for Provenge in the EU, and we do not believe the European opportunity, if there is one, would be profitable in any significance."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 11 Comments
  • TAHO

    Shares of Tahoe Resources (TAHO +15%) out paces its brethren to the upside in response to a...

    Shares of Tahoe Resources (TAHO +15%) out paces its brethren to the upside in response to a stabilization in precious metals, getting an added boost from a recent Seeking Alpha blog. The post called TAHO a good proxy for the price of silver, as investors who are bullish on the price of the metal, but also fear that the price may not rise short term, might consider taking a position in the shares instead.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +5.3%) rallies for the second day in a row thanks to analyst notes predicting...

    InvenSense (INVN +5.3%) rallies for the second day in a row thanks to analyst notes predicting iPhone design wins. Pac Crest thinks a 3-axis InvenSense gyroscope has been designed into a next-gen iPhone, and believes the win could add $0.40 to EPS (an iPad win is seen adding $0.20). Meanwhile, Maxim's Ashok Kumar is doing an about-face (previous) and stating checks indicate there's a "better than even chance" InvenSense will be designed into an expected low-cost iPhone. OTR Global wrote yesterday checks pointed to an InvenSense iPhone win.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • HSP

    Goldman Sachs' Jami Rubin weighs in on the CHMP's approval of Hospira's (HSP +5.4%) Remicade...

    Goldman Sachs' Jami Rubin weighs in on the CHMP's approval of Hospira's (HSP +5.4%) Remicade biosimilar Inflectra, calling it a landmark decision for biosimilars, but a negative for innovators. "This news is somewhat surprising since Inflectra had clinical data showing similarity to Remicade in RA only and sought to bridge from RA to other indications," said Rubin.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • HXL

    Shares of Hexcel (HXL -0.3%) aren't getting much of a boost from Oppenheimer today, who...

    Shares of Hexcel (HXL -0.3%) aren't getting much of a boost from Oppenheimer today, who initiated the shares with a Perform rating. The firm thinks HXL is a compelling play on rising commercial aircraft production rates and on the secular growth of carbon composite content on new aerospace platforms. However, based on the immediate fundamentals, its valuation seems fair at current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • PES

    Pioneer Energy Services (PES -1.6%) slips today after Wunderlich starts out coverage with a...

    Pioneer Energy Services (PES -1.6%) slips today after Wunderlich starts out coverage with a less than enthusiastic Hold rating and $7 price target. Wunderlich says the cyclical market has been tough on the company over recent years, which, coupled with the spending to grow its capacity, has boosted debt levels significantly. The firm thinks a better overall market is necessary before the company will be able to improve its financial position.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • EMMS

    "Results like these are the reason [we are] known as one of the best operators of radio stations...

    "Results like these are the reason [we are] known as one of the best operators of radio stations in the country," Emmis Communications' (EMMS +19.3%) CEO Jeff Smulyan says, referencing the 536% Y/Y increase in operating income the company reported Friday morning. Diluted EPS came in at $0.08 on revenue of $36.9M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • OC

    Owens Corning (OC -3.8%) slips todya after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral and lowered its...

    Owens Corning (OC -3.8%) slips todya after Citigroup cut the shares to Neutral and lowered its price target on the stock to $43 from $48 a share. The stock has been in a gradual decline since mid-May, after briefly testing a new high but failing to follow through.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • AMSC

    In addition to Ascendiant Capital's bullish coverage launch, American Superconductor (AMSC...

    In addition to Ascendiant Capital's bullish coverage launch, American Superconductor (AMSC +14.1%) could be getting a lift from the DOJ's decision to charge former customer Sinovel and two of its employees with trade secret theft. AMSC has long accused Sinovel of stealing code used to control a wind turbine's electricity flow for use in its own turbines, and is seeking $1.2B+ in damages in Chinese courts. Ascendiant, which is setting a $3.25 PT, expects AMSC to reach breakeven EBITDA by the end of 2014, and sees the company as a play on recovering wind power demand and smart grid growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • HALO

    Midday top 10 gainers: HALO +26%. EMMS +19%. SAND +17%. AMSC +15%. TRX +14%. RIC +13%. FSM +12%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: HALO +26%. EMMS +19%. SAND +17%. AMSC +15%. TRX +14%. RIC +13%. FSM +12%. TAHO +12%. ABFS +11%. LAS +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: QLTI -48%. OTC:CDTI -36%. BBRY -25%. LHCG -14%. GTIV -13%. AZZ -13%. AMED -13%. ACN -11%. ETRM -9%. AFAM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ -0.8%) Janssen Research & Development unit says the FDA has...

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ -0.8%) Janssen Research & Development unit says the FDA has rejected the approval of its blood thinner Xarelto as oral anticoagulant used to reduce the risk of stent thrombosis in patients with acute coronary syndrome. Since aprroving the drug in July 2011, the agency has expanded its use for treating certain blood clots and reducing their recurrence, and is currently approved for six clinical uses in the United States. Xarelto is co-marketed by JNJ and Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • BB

    Macquarie has cut BlackBerry (BBRY -25.2%) to Underperform following its FQ1 miss. Nomura notes...

    Macquarie has cut BlackBerry (BBRY -25.2%) to Underperform following its FQ1 miss. Nomura notes EPS would've been -$0.03 rather than -$0.13 if not for one-time items, but this is still below a $0.07 consensus. Guidance for an FQ2 operating loss suggests FQ2 EPS will be below a $0.12 consensus. Thorsten Heins stated on the earnings call the PlayBook won't receive a BB10 upgrade. Service revenue -16% Q/Q, would've been -9% if not for Venezuelan currency issues. Inventories +$284M Q/Q to $887M; North America was 24.8% of revenue, EMEA 43.7%, Latin America 14.6% (hurt by Venezuela), and Asia-Pac 16.9%. Subscriber data won't be given going forward. The Q5 is said to have a relatively low margin. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 24 Comments
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO -1%) prices its $400M private placement of senior notes due 2021. The...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO -1%) prices its $400M private placement of senior notes due 2021. The notes are being sold at par with an 8.75% coupon. The company expects to use the net proceeds, together with cash on hand, to fund its acquisition of Discovery Offshore and the final payment of $333.9M due for Discovery Triumph and Discovery Resilience.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • WPRT

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT -1.6%) reverse course to trade lower on a bit of profit...

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT -1.6%) reverse course to trade lower on a bit of profit taking after a solid two-day run higher. Earlier this morning, the company announced it's acquired Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) subsidiaries BAF Technologies and ServoTech Engineering for $25M in stock. Both companies also announced a $5M joint marketing and sales program.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products (NX +2%) ticks higher this morning after Sidoti ups the shares from...

    Quanex Building Products (NX +2%) ticks higher this morning after Sidoti ups the shares from Neutral to Buy on valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • ARNA

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -6.8%) dip on disappointing Belviq script data. According...

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -6.8%) dip on disappointing Belviq script data. According to TheStreet's Adam Feuerstein, Belviq TRx for week of June 21st were just 1,829, citing IMS. For the week of June 14th they were 1,087.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 19 Comments
  • HALO

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +15%) surge on the announcement that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY)...

    Shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +15%) surge on the announcement that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) has received a positive recommendation from the European Medicines Agency's CHMP for the subcutaneous formulation of Herceptin using Halozyme's recombinant human hyaluronidase, for the treatment of HER2-positive breast cancer in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca (AZN -1.2%) completes its acquisition of Pearl Therapeutics, now owning 100% of...

    AstraZeneca (AZN -1.2%) completes its acquisition of Pearl Therapeutics, now owning 100% of Pearl's shares. The acquisition further expands AZN's reach in the development of inhaled small-molecule therapeutics for respiratory disease, and gives the pharma-giant access to a potential new treatment for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, currently in late-stage development.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Goldman's Brian Lee expects shares of Molycorp (MCP +7.3%) "will trade higher in the near-term...

    Goldman's Brian Lee expects shares of Molycorp (MCP +7.3%) "will trade higher in the near-term given the removal of [the SEC] overhang" (previous). Nevertheless, the "fundamentals [are] relatively challenging," he says, as MCP "ramps toward full-scale Phase I production at its Mountain Pass facility [and as] rare earth prices have begun to experience declines in recent months." In other words: Investors may want to curb their enthusiasm after today's gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 9 Comments
  • ARCB

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +14.7%) surges after ABF employees ratify a collective bargaining agreement...

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +14.7%) surges after ABF employees ratify a collective bargaining agreement — the deal represents a "critical step in helping return ABF to its historic profitability," according to the press release.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +5%) rallies after Stifel's George Askew reports his firm's Q2 ad tracker "suggests...

    WebMD (WBMD +5%) rallies after Stifel's George Askew reports his firm's Q2 ad tracker "suggests WebMD continues to experience an improving advertising environment driven by structural pricing changes in 4Q12," and predicts Q2 results will beat guidance. Askew adds the health info provider is seeing growing advertiser diversity and stronger spending from existing advertisers. Shares +103% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • NDLS

    Shares of Noodles (NASDAQ:NDLS) pop in their initial trades as the IPO originally priced at $13...

    Shares of Noodles (NASDAQ:NDLS) pop in their initial trades as the IPO originally priced at $13 to $15 draws in buyers as high as $36 per share. At its current trading price, investors are betting on a huge amount of growth for the relatively small fast-casual chain (327 restaurants).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI -36%) plunges after pricing its public offering consisting...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI -36%) plunges after pricing its public offering consisting of 1.6M shares of common stock at a per share price of $1.245 and warrants to purchase an additional 800K shares with an exercise price of $1.25 per share - a 33% discount to yesterday's close. The offering also comes just days after the company announced the completion of its strategic review, in which it decided to "reduce the need for capital expenditures" to pursue the development of its materials science platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • HPQ

    An H-P-led (HPQ -0.1%) team has won a 5-year IT services/support contract from the U.S. Navy...

    An H-P-led (HPQ -0.1%) team has won a 5-year IT services/support contract from the U.S. Navy that has a max value of $3.45B. H-P, which has been running the Navy's telecom network since '08, beat out a rival bid led by Computer Sciences (CSC -3.5%) and Harris (HRS -0.8%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments

  • Precious metals see a bout of major buying, with gold (GLD +1.5%) jumping about $25/ounce in the...

    Precious metals see a bout of major buying, with gold (GLD +1.5%) jumping about $25/ounce in the past few minutes, and silver (SLV +4.8%) soaring nearly a $1. Bearish for some time, Mark Dow reminds gold has been going down for 2 years, but the decline has only recently made the headlines. Gold's post-QE run was built on a number of misconceptions which have all cracked. The longs (silver too) are trapped and the bear market isn't close to over.
     

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 39 Comments
  • STP

    Bankrupt Suntech (STP -5.3%) extends its forbearance period with holders of its 3% convertible...

    Bankrupt Suntech (STP -5.3%) extends its forbearance period with holders of its 3% convertible senior notes to Aug. 30. However, the new forbearance deal "contemplates an equitization of all major debt claims" held by debtholders, and gives them the right to nominate two board members. Suntech adds it will work with debtholders in the coming weeks on ""a framework agreement regarding the specific terms of a debt restructuring and equitization," and to "identify strategic and financial investors to bring in new capital." (Swiss moratorium) (Chinese creditors)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM

  • AZZ (AZZ 13.4%) takes a hit this morning after its Q1 misses across the board despite a big jump...

    AZZ (AZZ 13.4%) takes a hit this morning after its Q1 misses across the board despite a big jump in total revenue. Net earnings fell by 9% Y/Y as acquisition charges and losses from a fire weighed on its bottom line. Operating margin narrowed significantly from 19.7% to 12.8%. Looking forward, the company expects current-quarter earnings of $0.60 to $0.70 per share on revenue of $195M to $210M, below Street projections of $0.79 per share on revenue of $230M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • ACN

    UBS and Raymond James downgrade Accenture (ACN -13.2%) following an FQ3 revenue miss market by...

    UBS and Raymond James downgrade Accenture (ACN -13.2%) following an FQ3 revenue miss market by light consulting sales/orders, and soft guidance. UBS' Steve Milunovich, who now rates shares Neutral: "With Oracle and Accenture missing, enterprise demand appears to remain weak, which probably means a soft earnings season for large computer names." He thinks IBM (IBM -2.8%) could still deliver 2H services growth due to less consulting exposure and strong orders, but believes risk has grown. (FQ3 results/call: I, II, III) (CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 4 Comments
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +4.4%) jumps after the CHMP renders a positive opinion on Provenge for the...

    Dendreon (DNDN +4.4%) jumps after the CHMP renders a positive opinion on Provenge for the "treatment of asymptomatic or minimally symptomatic metastatic (non-visceral) castrate resistant prostate cancer." It will be interesting to watch how analysts react given the drug's Q1 numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • JBLU

    More on JetBlue (JBLU +5.4%): The buyout buzz centers on a report in a Brazilian newspaper...

    More on JetBlue (JBLU +5.4%): The buyout buzz centers on a report in a Brazilian newspaper tipping off David Neeleman wants to create a fund to purchase TAP and JetBlue together. There are indications that Brazilian government-backed BNDS would invest in the fund.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +11.3%) rises sharply in morning trading. Wedbush's Betty Chen ups her...

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +11.3%) rises sharply in morning trading. Wedbush's Betty Chen ups her price target on the shares to $4 from $3.75, noting that "current fashion trends are rooted in the 'California lifestyle,'" represented by retailers like PSUN, Zumiez (ZUMZ +2.9%), and Tilly's (TLYS +0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (SNY +0.2%) gets some good news in the form of a positive CHMP opinion for Genzyme's MS...

    Sanofi (SNY +0.2%) gets some good news in the form of a positive CHMP opinion for Genzyme's MS treatment alemtuzumab. In addition, the committee is also positive on a new active substance designation for teriflunomide. Wells Fargo's Brian Abrahams believes the teriflunomide news bodes well for Biogen (BIIB +5.8%) as it "illustrates CHMP/EMA is open to a sponsor's arguments that a new drug should merit some regulatory exclusivity."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • JBLU

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +5.3%) race higher at the open off unsubstantiated talk that a buyout...

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +5.3%) race higher at the open off unsubstantiated talk that a buyout could be in the works.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 4 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -26%) states on its FQ1 call BB10 phones made up 40% of the quarter's...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -26%) states on its FQ1 call BB10 phones made up 40% of the quarter's smartphone sales. That implies ~2.7M shipments, below a consensus of 3M+ (had risen in recent weeks). BlackBerry subs totaled 72M, -4M Q/Q. Total smartphone shipments +13% Q/Q and -13% Y/Y. 71% of revenue came from hardware, 26% from services, and 3% from software/other. That's a major shift from FQ4's 61%/36%/3%, and suggests service fee cuts and sub losses took a toll. They also affected gross margin, which fell 620 bps Q/Q to 33.9% after rising 970 bps in FQ4; it was still up 590 bps Y/Y. Opex -15% Y/Y to $1.21B thanks to last year's job cuts, but +11% Q/Q thanks to higher marketing spend. (PR) (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 14 Comments
  • AMSC

    Premarket gainers: AMSC +13%. DNDN +11%. MCP +8%. ACI +6%. PTR +5%. Losers: OTC:CDTI -35%. BBRY...

    Premarket gainers: AMSC +13%. DNDN +11%. MCP +8%. ACI +6%. PTR +5%.
    Losers: OTC:CDTI -35%. BBRY -23%. AMED -23%. ACN -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment

  • Indonesia shares (EIDO, IDX) rise 3% as nearly $100M in foreign money flows into the market, the...

    Indonesia shares (EIDO, IDX) rise 3% as nearly $100M in foreign money flows into the market, the most since the beginning of May. Foreign inflows are similarly robust in Malaysia where stocks (EWM) jump 1.25%. Across the region, Thai (THD) shares inch up as the SET hits a two week high, the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) rises 1%, and in Manila, Philippine shares add 2.17% to yesterday's gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMED

    Home health providers are in for a rough session after Baird downgrades the entire sector to...

    Home health providers are in for a rough session after Baird downgrades the entire sector to sell and slashes price targets. Noting the stocks have moved up in anticipation of the best outcome for the Medicare update, Baird says the actual result - including the rebase - couldn't have been worse. "Importantly, CMS's methodology ties its hands and leaves very little hope for a large reprieve in the final rule." AMED -12.8%, GTIV -11.7%, AFAM -9.5%, LHCG -5.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) gains 15% premarket after selling its Utah operations - Canyon Fuel Company...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) gains 15% premarket after selling its Utah operations - Canyon Fuel Company - to Bowie Resources for $435M in cash. "The sale of our Utah operations is consistent with our previously announced plan to unlock value for our shareholders by divesting certain non-core thermal coal assets." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 10 Comments
  • BB

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY) FQ1 earnings: The stock's off 16% premarket after the big miss on both...

    More on BlackBerry (BBRY) FQ1 earnings: The stock's off 16% premarket after the big miss on both lines. Smartphone shipments of 6.8M were up 13% sequentially, but fell far short of the 7.5M consensus. "The smartphone market remains highly competitive, making it difficult to estimate units, revenue, and levels of profitability." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM | 29 Comments
  • FEZ

    European stocks (NYSEARCA:FEZ) are mixed, with support coming from Japanese economic data and a...

    European stocks (NYSEARCA:FEZ) are mixed, with support coming from Japanese economic data and a chorus of Fed policy makers proclaiming that this isn't the end of QE as we know it. Expect more of the same later today from another set of speakers. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London +0.3%, Paris -0.1%, Frankfurt +0.1%, Madrid +0.4%, Milan -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 AM

  • Asian shares rise to end what's been a fairly torrid quarter on an upbeat note. Japan (DXJ)...

    Asian shares rise to end what's been a fairly torrid quarter on an upbeat note. Japan (DXJ) leads the way following generally positive economic data, including CPI and industrial production. China (FXI), says, investment adviser Peter Esho, is "close to a turnaround as sentiment is at rock bottom." Even if the financial system has issues, "there might be short-term fixes from the government." Japan +3.5%, Hong Kong +1.4%, China +1.5%, India +2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 AM
